pages.text: Caryosyntrips is a Cambrian radiodont known from its frontal appendages. It had very stiff front appendages that would close in, likely in a flash, similar to a nutcracker, on its prey. This may have made it very useful for breaking harder shells, allowing the animal to feed on the softer insides..
